responses: Hello! How can I assist you today?
Hi there! What would you like to know about me?
Hey! Feel free to ask me anything about my resume.

patterns: Can you tell me your name?
responses: My name is Maximiliano López Montaño, my pronouns are he/him, and I'm passionate about software development and technology.

patterns: Where can I find you online?
Do you have any social media profiles?
How can I get in touch with you?
responses: You can reach me via email at max.lopz.montn@gmail.com. I'm also on GitHub at https://github.com/max-lopzzz and LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/max-lopezzz/.

patterns: Do you speak any other languages?
Which languages are you fluent in?
Can you tell me about your language skills?
How many languages do you know?
responses: I'm a native Spanish speaker, grew up with English as a second language, and have a B1 level in German.

patterns: Give me a summary about you
responses: I'm deeply passionate about software development and technology. I'm currently studying Engineering in Computer Technologies at Tecnológico de Monterrey. I've worked on projects like creating a real estate comparison tool and developing an optimal Pokémon battle team generator. Beyond academics, I'm a project coordinator for the Society of Students of Engineering in Computer Technologies and a collaborator for the Association for Inclusion, Respect and Equity, promoting respect for members of the LGBTQ+ community.

patterns: Where do you go to school?
responses: I'm pursuing a Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Technologies at Tecnológico de Monterrey, expected to graduate in 2028. I also completed the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme at PrepaTec Eugenio Garza Lagüera in 2024.

patterns: Are you part of any student groups?
What student organizations are you in?
Tell me about your involvement in student groups
Are you involved in any student organizations?
What student activities are you a part of?
Do you participate in any clubs or groups?
responses: Yes, I'm actively involved in student groups like the Society of Students of Engineering in Computer Technologies (SAITC), where I serve as Project Coordinator. I'm also a member of the Tec Mountaineering Club (CMT), which allows me to pursue my love for mountain biking and outdoor activities. Additionally, I'm a collaborator in the Association for Inclusion, Respect and Equity (AIRE), promoting respect for the LGBTQ+ community within my campus.

patterns: What programming languages do you know?
responses: I have strong skills in programming languages such as Python, Java, C++, and Swift. I also have a solid understanding of data structures and algorithms, debugging and testing skills, experience in task automation, custom software solutions, and effective teamwork and communication skills.

patterns: What kind of projects have you worked on?
Can you share your work experience?
responses: I've worked on projects like creating a real estate comparison tool and generating Pokémon battle teams. I was the Project Leader for initiatives like the Otomí Cultural Centre Renovation, School Supply Drives, and 'Plantando el Cambio'. I'm also involved with SAITC as a Project Coordinator and with AIRE promoting inclusivity.

patterns: Have you been recognized for your work?
responses: I've received several awards including the International Baccalaureate Diploma, Optimal Development Badge, Performance Diploma, Perseverance Diploma, Fraternity Diploma, and Messengers of Peace Award. These recognize my leadership, community service, academic achievements, and personal growth.

patterns: What is the International Baccalaureate Diploma?
Tell me about the IB Diploma
What does the IB Diploma entail?
responses: The International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Programme is a two-year educational program aimed at students aged 16 to 19. It provides an internationally recognized qualification and focuses on developing critical thinking, intercultural understanding, and respect for others. I completed this program in July 2024, taking HL subjects in Spanish Literature, Business and Management, and Computer Science, and SL subjects in German, Physics, and Mathematics. I received an A on my Extended Essay, gaining skills in critical thinking, problem-solving, and a solid academic foundation in Computer Science.

patterns: What is the Optimal Development Badge?
Tell me about the Optimal Development Badge
What does the Optimal Development Badge recognize?
How did you earn the Optimal Development Badge?
What is required for the Optimal Development Badge?
Can you explain the Optimal Development Badge?
responses: The Optimal Development Badge is awarded for achieving the highest level of personal development in the Walker Community, a scouting section for youth aged 15-17. I received this badge in May 2024 from the Asociación de Scouts de México A.C. The requirements included earning first-level competency badges in various areas, achieving a sustainable development badge, and participating actively for over two years.

patterns: Tell me about the Performance Diploma
What does the Performance Diploma recognize?
How did you earn the Performance Diploma?
What are the criteria for the Performance Diploma?
Can you explain the Performance Diploma?
responses: The Performance Diploma, issued by the Asociación de Scouts de México A.C. in September 2023, recognizes leadership in two consecutive Scout sections. I served as Patrol Guide for the 'Lions' Patrol in the Troop section (ages 11-14) and founded and coordinated the 'Jeanne D'Arc' Team in the Walker Community (ages 15-17). This award acknowledges my dedication to leadership, teamwork, and collaboration.

patterns: Tell me about the Perseverance Diploma
How did you earn the Perseverance Diploma?
What does the Perseverance Diploma recognize?
Explain the Perseverance award in Scouts
responses: The Perseverance Diploma was awarded to me by the Asociación de Scouts de México A.C. in September 2023 for my active participation in both the Troop and Walker Community sections. It recognizes the development of skills such as teamwork, problem-solving, and leadership through years of engagement in scouting activities.

patterns: Tell me about the Fraternity Diploma
What does the Fraternity Diploma recognize?
How did you earn the Fraternity Diploma?
What are the criteria for the Fraternity Diploma?
Can you explain the Fraternity Diploma?
responses: The Fraternity Diploma, issued by the Asociación de Scouts de México A.C. in September 2022, recognizes my efforts in leading community service projects that promote peace, unity, and well-being. I led initiatives, clean-up campaigns, and organized events aimed at fostering inclusivity and local development.

patterns: What is the Messengers of Peace Award?
Tell me about the Messengers of Peace Award
What does the Messengers of Peace Award recognize?
Are you a Messenger of Peace?
How did you earn the Messengers of Peace Award?
Can you explain the Messengers of Peace Award?
responses: The Messengers of Peace Award was issued to me by the World Organization of the Scout Movement in September 2019. I received it for leading the renovation of the Lomas Modelo Community Center as part of the 'Better World Framework,' contributing to the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). This project included team leadership, securing sponsorships, organizing community events, and a toy drive for children.

patterns: What extracurricular activities do you do?
What do you do outside of school or work?
Tell me about your interests beyond academics
What do you enjoy doing in your free time?
responses: I'm actively involved in extracurriculars such as the Tec Mountaineering Club (CMT), where I enjoy mountain biking. I'm also passionate about drumming—especially as a metal drummer—and gaming, including Dungeons and Dragons. I've been involved in Scouting since I was 10, which has taught me leadership, teamwork, and community service.

patterns: Tell me about your scouting experience
What do you do in scouts?
What roles have you held in scouting?
Can you share your scouting background?
responses: Yes, I've been a Scout since I was 10. I served as Patrol Guide for the 'Lions' Patrol, and later founded and led the 'Jeanne D'Arc' team. My scouting experience has shaped my values in leadership, teamwork, and community service, leading to awards like the Optimal Development Badge and Messengers of Peace recognition.

patterns: What kind of projects have you led?
What projects have you worked on?
Do you have experience managing projects?
What were some significant projects you have contributed to?
Can you share some of the projects you've done?
responses: I've led various projects including the renovation of the Otomí Cultural Centre, school supply drives, and 'Plantando el Cambio.' I developed a real estate comparison tool and a Pokémon battle team generator. Each project allowed me to apply my skills and collaborate with others in meaningful ways.
Goodbye! Feel free to reach out if you have more questions. Have a great day!
See you later! I'm here whenever you need assistance.
